etymology.description: Phonetic: 厂(厂) (hǎn, "cliff") + Semantic: 彣(彣) (wén, "variegated; literary talent") = elegant person -> elegant
etymology.interpretation: The character combines a phonetic component, 厂(厂) (hǎn, "cliff"), with a semantic component, 彣(彣) (wén, "variegated; literary talent"), suggesting someone with refined or 'elegant' literary talent.

examples.chinese: 他的举止彥雅(他的舉止彥雅)。
他文章深沉(他文章深沉)，举止彥雅(舉止彥雅)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wénzhāng shēnchén, jǔzhǐ yàn yǎ.
examples.english: His writing is profound, and his behavior is elegant.

examples.chinese: 他总是言谈举止流露出彥风(他總是言談舉止流露出彥風)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒng shì yántán jǔzhǐ liúlù chū yàn fēng.
examples.english: He always reveals an elegant aura in his speech and manners.
